result.execSummary:
The defendant William D Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: William D Berry
parties.address: 4614 A West Capitol Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53216

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: *Defendant may have release to the Day Reporting Center and release to participate in educational/vocational programming at the House of Correction. Defendant may NOT have work release unless employed at the time of revocation.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
*If revoked, court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds and earnings.
*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.

*Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol.
*Participate in a cognitive thinking program.
*Random urine screens.
*Participate in vocational programming full time.

timeConds.notes: *Perform 30 hours of community service. All hours to be completed within the first 6 months of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D Berry

defendant.name: Berry, William D

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) gj

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant William D Berry in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant William D Berry in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder on behalf of Kimberly Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Praties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Court previously set cash bail in the amount of $1,000.00 at the Bail/Bond Hearing conducted on 8/24/15. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Received and FIled, Justice Point Report.

Attorney McCandless contacted the Court requesting this matter be rescheduled due to scheduling unavailability. State notified. Case adjourned to 8/24/15 at 1:30 p.m. for Return on Warrant in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 8/18/15. Parties notified. Clerk contacted SPD for appointment of new counsel in this case. Case adjourned to 8/25/15 at 8:30 a.m. for Return on Warrant in Branch 25. Bench warrant in file. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was present in court all morning, but left at the break before his case was called.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.   State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. Possible victim identified therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Discharge Summary Report from Justice Point, filed.
Violation report received and filed.

Defendant William D Berry in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled.  Justice Point contacted the court and advised that defendant had a positive breathalyzer test (.007).  Conditions of bail reiterated; defendant admonished.  Case remains as previously scheduled.

Defendant William D Berry in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant may be eligible for Veterans Court.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM005717  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-04-2015
Defense motion for modification of bail heard and granted.  Court modifies bail to $250.00 cash with same previous conditions

Defendant William D Berry in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant William D Berry in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William D Berry in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant William D Berry in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
